original: When a ligand binds to a receptor, it can influence the behavior of another cell, depending on the receptor type. For example, neurotransmitters that interact with ionotropic receptors can modify the excitability of target cells. Other receptor types include protein kinase receptors, such as the insulin receptor, and G protein-coupled receptors (GPCRs).
